attributes.comment:
I find it appalling that the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is proposing
to raise fees by a staggering 66% for adoption programs that are designed to give
orphaned children a home. Most families seeking to adopt outside of the United
States are not wealthy. We do what we can to scrape together the $20,000 on
average that it costs to complete an adoption. Raising these fees adds further
burden to this already staggering sum and will surely reduce the number of
orphans that can be adopted in the future. I urge you to reconsider raising the fees
proposed in docket number (USCIS-2006-0044).

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Pam H. Oneal
